Reviews.Title: “AVOID!!!”
Reviews.Author: WeLoveToTravelWorld
Reviews.Content: While we found the rooms nice, clean and in very good repair, the same can't be said for the staff and/or the breakfast. I've had a more positive experience at hotels I've stayed in for less time and spent far less money per room night. We had what are typically small problems, i.e. an outlet was not working & the wifi signal wasn't strong in our room. Calling the desk accomplished nothing, and after the 3rd call, I went to the front desk to discuss the issues and they seems bothered that I asked them to do something. Ridiculous... The food on the breakfast buffet was very bad and true staff there was clearly frustrated that they were forced to field the many complaints from the guests. With the decent location of this property, they would have to turn people away if they fired their existing food and beverage staff and upgraded the talent at the front desk. It's a shame that the staff did a great job in souring our time there. Never again will we stay at a Crowne Plaza. If it were possible to give this property a '0' rating, I would.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Lobby... Disappointing Room, Poor Service In Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: calaislily
Reviews.Content: Was on a group tour and stayed for just one night. The assigned room was small and had one tiny window. Bathroom had a narrow, rectangular layout with the "throne" right behind the door. One needs to maneuver a little just to close the door :( Definitely not for anyone who's of a larger size. No shelving was available in the shower so it's quite hard to place your personal shampoo and stuff. During breakfast at the restaurant, we waited for at least 15mins for the service staff to serve us coffee. It seemed they ran out of coffee cups (rather strange for such a large hotel). Overall, other than the beautiful lobby we weren't impressed. By the way, Wi-Fi wasn't working either!

Reviews.Title: “less value for money not possible”
Reviews.Author: poeschel
Reviews.Content: since our connection flight was missed (avoid Turkish Airlines ...) we were brought to this hotel for one night: we got incredibly tiny rooms just below the roof, with smallest windows down on bottom of the wall - and the ventilation fan of all hotel right before the window: even closed you had the impression of sitting still in the aircraft ! to immagine that I had paid for it myself, would have driven me simply crazy ... here are by far better hotels - at more reasonable rates !!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Showing”
Reviews.Author: B96SAL
Reviews.Content: Albert Einstein once said that doing the same thing over and over and expecting a different result was insanity. I'm a Priority Club Platinum member and have returned to this hotel from time-to-time hoping things will improve. I give up. The location is great for my interests. But when you have to ask the staff to help with luggage, and one thing after another either does not work, or is misrepresented, its just isn't representative of an IHG property and certainly not 5*.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel - Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: ColinJames-Hereford
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in March 2012. I was here on business with a few colleges. The hotel is in the heart of the old city, plenty of bars, shops and restaurants all around. There is a mosque opposite the hotel that plays song at 5am but you get used to it. Rooms were really nice and clean hotel staff were excellent, would certainly stay here again and Istanbul is a fantastic city to visit can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “5 star hmmm? - luxury it is not!”
Reviews.Author: saba s
Reviews.Content: Usually accustomed to luxury five star hotels - this was not - toiletries are limited and nothing special - even in the suites (no hair conditioner provided). No slippers, flannels, nice robes. It claims to be wheel chair accessible and offered us a hotel wheel chair for our three day trip which was broken and stuck in every lift or gap. My wheelchair bound mother was unable to enter and exit the hotel in dignity having to be wheeled out of a side entrance for deliveries in the basement. The corridors and rooms are small and lack usual basics such as fruit or flowers offered in room. Breakfast was limited in choice and of poor quality as was all the food in the premises and breakfast service generally poor. The staff were not bending over backwards in the slightest and reluctant at times avoiding eye contact. We were ill advised by the staff even though as a lady with an elderly wheelchair bound and two young children, they should have taken more care. They ruined the trip for me by arranging a tour with a company who took a whole days money and ran off after 3 hours, together with not knowing that the Old City is impossile to navigate with a wheelchair let alone a broken one provided by them. Even on departure instead of offering the hotel minibus they made me pay for a hired coach with seating for atleast a dozen people and their baggage. I do not recommend anyone with any special needs to come to this hotel or Istanbul for that matter. All in all the trip was a horrid one no thanks to Crowne Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Location”
Reviews.Author: Frleb
Reviews.Content: really very nice hotel, clean! very good location, easy access to main sightseeing, close tram stop to the other part of city! Good Breakfast and varied. Very close to Grand Bazar! Rooms are clean I would recommend corner rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and good location”
Reviews.Author: Michael_Zh85
Reviews.Content: really very nice hotel, clean! very good location, easy access to main sightseeing, close tram stop to the other part of city and even grand market didnt annoyed us :))))

Reviews.Title: “Crowne Plaza Hotel Old City Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Peter P
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Crowne Plaza in the old city of Istanbul for a week during spring of 2011. Entrance to the lobby at check in was through a fashion store since reconstruction of the roadway in the front of the hotel prevented vehicle access, however, this was only a minor inconvenience. The lobby is very well appointed, with very high ceilings and quality furnishings also true of the hotel in general. Our room was first class with plenty of space and tastefully furnished. There is a very well kept indoor pool staffed permanently with attendants. Check in was very efficient and the hotel staff were very helpful and friendly at all times. The restaurant is not too large, in an open area immediately adjacent to the lobby, meals are also available in the lobby area itself. The menu is not particularly inspiring but offers reasonable fare. There are many restaurants of varying size in the general vicinity of the hotel offering both local and international dishes and open throughout the day. We had breakfast and some other meals and on those occasions when we ate dinner in the hotel we chose the lobby area since the atmosphere was more convivial than in the restaurant itself. The location is extremely convenient and very close to several significant attractions many interesting features are within walking distance easy access is also available by very regular tram service in the street immediately outside the hotel. Tours can also be arranged very easily at a travel desk situated in the lobby. A very good hotel which we would definitely stay in again and can thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: D G
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel given its location (but later we saw there are so many other hotels in the old city) and because we knew that only a 5 star hotel in turkey could be as comfortable as a 3 star in western europe. Location is ok, however we had such a negative time in this hotel, although most of the day we were out in town. The hotel's most customers were men from Arabic countries (which is no problem in itself) but in the evening hours they would stay in groups in the corridors and talk loudly and we had a hard time sleeping at night. Furthmore, sometimes they would even knock on our door which was very disturbing...we thought they were trying to break in our room. We did not have breakfast in the hotel because it's unnecessarily expensive (17 Euro)...it is easy to have breafast in the surrounding cafe's. In overall we were dissapointed and will not go back again when visitng Turkey. Staff is also very wierd...not smiling at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good one night stay”
Reviews.Author: DBNCLTDXB
Reviews.Content: Room was okay a bit small and generally just a wierd floorplan. Staff at front desk and room service guy were good. Right next to the Laleli Mosque We have stayed at other locations in Istanbul before and preffered them but good to try a new place. We explored the 2 mosques nearby and the university areas before heading off to the main touristy areas.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, pleasant staff.”
Reviews.Author: samanabanaue
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here and enjoyed the location. The tram was only a block away and definitely the fastest way to get to the top tourist locations. The neighborhood is very pleasant for walking.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nice decor, relatively smaller rooms, awesome location.”
Reviews.Author: tahirasahar
Reviews.Content: Good five star hotel, so I will keep this review short and precise. Positive aspects: Nice interior, clean, prompt room service, awesome location (near Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, AyaSophia, tram, Grand Bazar, etc), the inside shops and travel agencies were very helpful. Indoor pool is good. Although it is in the middle of city, yet not noisy at all due to its intelligent architecture. Negative aspects: Staff is a little dry, menu card for roomservice does not have a large variety, no option for disabled as there were too many stairs and no slides for wheelchairs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Burhanbo
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel and very centrally located. The area where the is located is domanated by russian tourists. There is very good public transportation possibities just in front of the hotel. The stuff is very kind og helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Solid enough hotel though nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: Tagesthemen
Reviews.Content: I give the Crowne Plaza a 3.5. Better than average but nevertheless not "very good". Overall, it was "fine". Comfortable attic room which was OK as I was on a business trip but for a couple maybe a little bit small. As with most quality hotels in Istanbul, complimentary wireless internet. Breakfast was a mixed bag - I liked the fruit but gave what looked like curried sausages, the filtered coffee and the runny scrambled eggs a miss. Service friendly enough. A nice little gym. The location is good - near to the tram stop and a 15-minute walk to the Blue Mosque but overall found it uninspiring in a city with such a diversity of hotel choices.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: marmooraz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Crowne Plaza for 2 nights in November, the hotel generally is very good compared to other hotels in Istanbul. It's rated 5 stars but I would give it only 4. The biggest issue I had was the terrible smell of smoke in the room. Although I asked for a non-smoking room, the smell of smoke in the room and on the furniture was unbearable. The room was spacious and the bathroom was really clean. The big LCD TV had various channels in different languages. Breakfast buffet was good with different varieties of food. The time I stayed there is not a very busy time of the year in Istanbul so the hotel was not very crowded. I read a comment about difficulty to find a table at breakfast, I didn't have this problem but maybe during busy times of the year this could be true as the restaurant is not very big. The area where the hotel is located is called Laleli and it's not a luxury side of Istanbul. however, it's very close to most of the important city attactions (Sultanahmet bluemosque, Aya Sophia musuem, Topkapi palace, Gulhane Park, Yerebatan, Grand Bazaar..etc) The tram station is a 2 min walk from the hotel and a bus station is 5 min away. Not too many great restaurants are in the neighbourhood. but taking the tram to Sultanahmet station, you can find lots of restaurants. I would definitely stay again at Crowne Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient hotel for old town”
Reviews.Author: me1000uk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a night after spending 2 days in Istanbul on a quick visit. I wanted a good location to do a whirlwind tour of the main sites and this was excellent. The access to the rooms is a little bizarre and it is clear that the rooms were made to fit into whatever the previous incarnation of the building was, rather than the building built to fit the hotel rooms. So plenty of stranger corners/angles etc on the ceiling. The bed was very comfortable and the room was spacious. I would say this is typical of a chain hotel, and the equivalent of a 4 star Hilton hotel in other countries. The tram stop is literally almost outside the place, and I got to the hotel from the airport and back using public transport without much fuss. If you want a hotel in a good location but a good room to sleep in, with easy public transport access you can do a lot worse. Didn't try the food, as there were plenty of options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but very rude staff & Manager”
Reviews.Author: Malcolm996
Reviews.Content: We booked holiday in advance during December via British Airways. At the time of the booking I realized wrong rooms were booked and I contacted British airways to get correct rooms. They said to contact the hotel direct. I emailed and phoned hotels number of times and told them the rooms need to change ie...they booked 2 doubles but we had 2 adults and 5 children so we needed triples and extra beds. I was told by the reception that we will give you larger rooms if they are available. i asked them that to check the system now and take money from my card and change the rooms (ie....to check the availabilities now). i am a holier myself and know that this can be done. They said that at the time of check in just say that you want a different room. I told them that you may be full house on the day of check in. In any event I made all the logs of the call and made copied of the emails correspondences. On the day of arrival the reception staff said that there are too many people and you need to book another room and and demanding euro for extra room. I told them that 2 months before I was trying to sort this out but no one was listening. Any event I asked for the manager and a stone faced lady arrived without any warm or welcoming gestures and simply said what is the problem. I explained everything but she said same thing that you need to pay 200 euro for the night per room. Than I pulled out all my records of emails and phone call logs and they realised that they had cocked it up. To my surprise instead of apologizing and saying that "yes" you did tell us in advance they were embarrassed and said okay we will change the rooms and give you extra folding beds. I than kindly requested if they can keep the phone line in the rooms turned off and to empty the mini bar in the rooms as we had very young children aged 3, 4, 5 etc...and told them we do not want any alchole near the young children. At this time the manager and reception staff became very rude and said that this is not hostel or cheap hotel we are 5 start international hotel etc....you want extra beds, you want mini bar empty, you want this and that etc..... I was shocked and just said okay leave it and i will just pay. Oh my God,...... now further problems, I did not want to pay by my card and had a lot of cash with me. They said that we only accept euro and will charge you for the exchange rate for converting the money into Turkish Currency. I said that i already have Turkish currency so you can take it direct. They said that we will take Turkish currency and converted it into euro and than convert it back into Turkish etc.....this is stupid. They just wanted to make extra money and was embarrassed and you can see from there faces of what they were asking for was illogical. So now I had UK pounds and Turkish currency. I had to change UK Pounds into euro s and than into Turkish Currency and pay for all the exchange rates and fees, where as I already had lots of Turkish currency. In general the food and rooms were nice and the hotel is good. But staff will get 1 out of 10. The manager was very rude. I cannot wait to see what the manager had to say about my review and how they are going to reply. If they say something stupid like "this review is false, then remember I still have all the booking papers with me" they will just further embarrass them selves.

Reviews.Title: “Crowne Plaza - value for money if you are careful”
Reviews.Author: BABU07021964
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Istanbul, Turkey. We had gone there with family and friends (total 12). We stayed at the Crowne Plaza, Old Ciy. It was a good location, but some of the rooms given to us were attic rooms, where two could barely fit. We had booked about 2 months in advance, but ended up in this cramped up room. Service at the restaurants were pathetic, but room service was good. Location was quite good. We had only one lunch at the hotel, and the food was Baaaad !!!. Breakfast was much better. I will write some more if I recollect any +ve or -ve.

Reviews.Title: “ISTANBUL WHAT A PLEASURE”
Reviews.Author: Helenecruise
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this property on a few occasions and I am pleased to report that the standard is still just as good and staff are so helpful. One just relaxes the minutes one gets into the hotel. It is a 10 minute walk from the hotel to the Grand Bazaar, so extremely well situated. The hotel has a very good breakfast available, bar, coffee shop and restaurant. Will definitely go back to the Crowne Plaza again

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in Old City Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: R L
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really a building converted to a hotel. The interior is very confusing. You have shops left and right before a very long walk from the entrance to the front desk. I have a nice room on the highest floor of the hotel. Basically I take the lift to the top floor then walk a flight of stairs to a room right at the top. Its a nice big room but I am a bit dissapointed with the window. It only has a small round window ( a bit like stuck in a castle somewhere) As the hotel is quite old, the designs are too. The hotel is located on a very busy main road, so if you are a light sleeper you will have hard time sleeping. There is a tram stop about 5 mins walk from the hotel. The breakfast is not the best I've had at Crowne Plaza. There staff doesn't seems very attentive and tables were not clean. Also being an Asian I feel the hotel staff were a bit cold towards me. There are lots to do around the hotel. The Grand Bazaar is about 10 mins walk away so is the Blue Mosque. If you want the other side of Turkey (Taksim) then you can catch the tram which is about 30 mins ride away. Overall a nice hotel but not the best Crowne Plaza I've stayed in

Reviews.Title: “Busy breakfast buffet with too little seating; extremely rude waitress.”
Reviews.Author: Kylie B
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at different hotels in Istanbul and this one has been the worst. If we would have started our trip at the Crowne Plaza Old City, it wouldn't have been as enjoyable. The room was ok - we had a corner suite on the top floor that included a seating area, non-smoking but it still smelled like smoke and/or mold and we had to air it out daily. The outside streets are very busy and quite loud. Housekeeping was excellent; most other services were good but not as excellent as the other hotels in Sultanahmet (we also paid less for those hotels). The breakfast buffet was the biggest problem - too many people and too little seating, food is adequate but we've had much better for the same price. Crazy busy and rushed eating. I felt as though I couldn't relax and enjoy my meal. We were asked to leave our seats on the first morning by one of the waitresses, Burca, while trying to enjoy our fruit and second cup of coffee (because they were too busy and no seats were available). The next morning there were no seats available at all and we opted to sit outside the buffet area (there is another seating area for the hotel restaurant - which is closed during breakfast). We were brought sugars for our coffee and were told it was okay since no seats were open inside - until the same waitress, Burca, yelled at us that the area was closed ("NO!! THIS IS CLOSED FOR BREAKFAST!!"), then followed the yelling with a "TSSSK!", turned around and left, not even allowing us an explanation or the option to move inside. We instead left the buffet with some coffee to go. Istanbul is known for being an extremely hospitable and welcoming place, the nicest people in the world, and we've received service that was above and beyond in every establishment (hotels, restaurants, laundry, bar, grocer, convenient store). I've had absolutely no complaints about Istanbul until this experience. The amenities such as the fitness center, spa and pool are excellent; but I'd quickly trade them for excellent service and breakfast. Stay at the Kalyon or Yesil Ev - both locations and service are much better.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a lovely City”
Reviews.Author: H_SATTI
Reviews.Content: Had a corner room which was quite big.. the hotel it self was quite impressive with a very good location, the grand bazaar only a stroll away....didn't eat that much in the hotel with the Turkish cuisine around us.. buffet was good, but doesn't stand out... service was good... its a very good base to explore the city from, history is all around you... The hotel didn't especially cater for kids but not un-similar to other hotels. If we are in Istanbul again will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: TSOslo
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in great location. Very comfortable beds. Breakfast adequate but have tasted better..! rates are quite expensive. Would certainly not rate this as 5 stars but 4. Had booked nonsmoking room but was given a smoking room. The smell of smoke in the room was overwhelming so we complained and got a different room that smelled just as bad..Even with all windows wide open the stink of smoke in everything, curtains etc, was terrible and I felt I was gasping for my breath .....had difficulty sleeping because of the reeking smell. As a member of priority club I had expected better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not five star”
Reviews.Author: CPKOhio
Reviews.Content: Located within walking distance of the Grand Bazaar, The Blue Mosque, Saint Sophia and many other local attractions. This hotel was rated five stars by several web-sites. Although the rooms are decorated nicely, I believe most travelers in this category would find them small (Approx. 225 sf). The common areas are attractive, yet, the atrium skylightes which are a focal point, are intentionally muted with white material. Altough a very nice touch, the material has gathered a lot of dirt and it is noticable. Also, some of the common carpeting has obvious stains. Although I am being somewhat picky, in this price range and hotel class, these defects should not be present.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: mrstats69
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a great location in Old Town Istanbul. Close to the tram which will take you to all the major sites, or you're not too far of a walk either. A bit on the pricy side, but our room included a very nice buffet style breakfast. Rooms are VERY small, but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best location”
Reviews.Author: rediando
Reviews.Content: Although our room overlooked the neighborhood mosque across the street, and the bed was comfortable with a good shower in the bathroom, the location of the hotel is rather inconvenient to the major attractions. The nearest tram stop is in the university district, which is very crowded so you have to fight your way on board, and other travelers we met had their passports stolen while riding it. If you take a taxi, you need to be very specific about where you're going, as Istanbul has many odd winding streets and the drivers don't always know where restaurants are. The hotel staff was moderately attentive, but there seemed to be a guy out front who was working the taxis for his and his friends' benefit, a scam that the hotel chose not to notice.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: bibicu
Reviews.Content: The hotel is actually Crowne Plaza Hagia Ayasofia and is just 50 m from Aya Sofia , 100 m from Topkapi. The location is fantastic and the service is excellent. However , it does not look like a real hotel and you don't have any of the facilities. The breakfast is not at 5 stars level but is ok. The rooms are big and confortable.

Reviews.Title: “Crown Plaza Old City”
Reviews.Author: Kickazzboy
Reviews.Content: The most distinguish feature of this hotel is the decoration and the attic rooms (4th floor), others are just standard. The front desk staff was not really friendly, but the concierge was really helpful (I have been staying in this hotel every year for the past 4 years and i always see the same concierge staff). Avoid the rooms facing the main street, it's very noisy in the morning, try the attic room on the 4th floor, it's very special. The Location is great close to main tourist attractions in Istanbul, Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, etc. It's only 30 minutes away from Ataturk International Airport. The only thing is it's also close to Russian red light district, so if you travel alone, i recommend you not to walk around the area after 10pm. After several visits to Turkey in the past 4 years, I notice that Turkish people like to assume what you are saying even they don't fully understand(many don't speak english), which lead to misunderstanding, So when you request something, in the hotel for example, make sure that he/she understand what you want, especially when you hear the words "no problem" from them. This hotels is suitable for both business and leaisure travellers WITHOUT kids.

Reviews.Title: “Charged without notice”
Reviews.Author: Penny2011_11
Reviews.Content: I was charged for using their phone locally without any notice. The front desk didn't tell me and the room had no notices on prices next to the phone. When I checked, I asked about charges for international calls using a phone card. I was told no charge and was still charged for it. Only after I complained was I refunded. I complained about the local calls and wasn't refunded.

Reviews.Title: “Poor and Rude Service”
Reviews.Author: NEP126
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel and I requested a non- smoking room with a double bed. When I arrived and checked I found out that my room was a smoking room with terrible scent and there was no double bed. I requested to have my room changed but I have been told that this would be considered a new booking and that the previous rate wouldnâ€™t apply. I accepted the â€œrip-offâ€� but then I was told that no non-smoking rooms were available. I felt that there is no respect or professionalism on their client service approach. I will never stay at this hotel again nor I recommend it to anyone â€¦

Reviews.Title: “2 night post cruise stay at Old City Crowne Plaza Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: MelmicCork
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fabulous location, within walking distance of the Grand Bazaaar, and on the direct tram route to the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia, which are very near each other, it also continues on towards the port area where the Spice Market is located. We had a room at the top of the hotel, 4th floor and there is no lift access from floor 3 to 4 but the porter took our cases up those stairs. The room was quite comfortable and we did'nt have any problem with noise. The foyer is very impressive and big with glass lifts to the various floors. Breakfast was very good and on request we got gluten free bread for a coeliac. The only negative point was that the reception staff were not in the least friendly. There are many exchange banks along all the streets to change your money into Turkish Lira so no need to search for a big bank. There is one just around the corner from the hotel. The tram costs 2 T lira per trip and the machines give change if you have to use notes. If you arrive by cruise ship be warned that trying to get a taxi from the port can be quite a challenge. There was such a queue that we (along with many other people) had to walk out to the street and try to stop a taxi. With so many looking for taxis and of course no Turkish money, a lot of us were grossly overcharged, so for a taxi to the old city area from the port 15 - 20 euro is more than adequate but it could cost a lot lot more !!!!!! We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice big room but why is the pool always closed?”
Reviews.Author: BeachdaddyTucson
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not for people with bad knees or hips ... Lots of stairs no matter where you go ... even to/from the elevators. The room was clean, spacious and laid out so two people were not falling over each other. It was very convenient to the tram line and walking around to mosques, the Spice Market and Grand Bizarre along with other tourist destinations. Food was mediocre ... and expensive but that was expected. There is a great sweets shop around the corner on the tram line street about a block and a half up hill. Do try the many varieties of baklava and Turkish Delight. Shower had great water pressure. However free wi-fi only worked intermittently (mostly not) in the room, and had to go to the lobby to "do" email. When asked was provided a cable to plug into the wall socket but still didn't work ... and they charged for the cable w/o mentioning it... however that charge was removed once cable was returned. The big complaint was the pool, as mentioned in other reviews, was never open. Different people gave different excuses and possible times it might open after we had moved on ... however it was hot and we had picked this hotel, among other things because it had a pool where we could go take a dip and refresh ourselves!!

Reviews.Title: “All good”
Reviews.Author: StevoA
Reviews.Content: If you want to see the bazaar, this is the hotel to stay, head out the front, hang a left and walk down a couple blocks to the entrance of the bazaar, it's an experience. The hotel was nice enough, staff was good, processed us through very quickly, room was bit cramped but it was comfortable. the lobby is great and has a restaurant that serves food and drinks. For a cheaper option, from the entrance, hang a right and walk about two blocks, there should be a small corner stand that sells beer, juice, and snacks at a much more reasonable price than the hotel. I would definitely recommend their spa services, very good shiatsu given at this place, book an appointment prior to 4pm, it seems to get crowded in the evening time. Overall, no real complaints.

Reviews.Title: “An Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MuhamedOsman
Reviews.Content: Absolutely gorgeous hotel. Magnificent foyer. Concierge & travel guide gave excellent service. The location is very convenient. Close to the tram service, this allows you to tour Istanbul extremely easily. 5 minutes by tram from Hotel to Blue Mosque & other well know attractions. Rooms are very spacious & bathrooms were clean. Breakfast was delightful, with a wide range. They have an awesome sauna, hot room, pool & shower. Definitely something to do, a couples enjoyment. They offer traditional Turkish baths as well, exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...particularly for first time visitors to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Syd A
Reviews.Content: Definitely worth the premium you would pay for this hotel. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Location is great, walking distance from the Historic Area (Aya Sofia, Sultan Ahmet, Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace). We even walked it from Suleiymanie Mosque, but that was about a 30 minute walk. The good thing about this particular hotel is that Taxi drivers will know exactly where you need to go if you just give them the name (did not require explaining which hotel or where it was) as there is definitely a language barrier in Turkey and it's sometimes difficult to explain to the cab drivers where you want to go. They all know where this hotel is though. Has a fantastic restaurant...room service was top notch too. Ordered food at 2:00 AM once and it was still brought up without delay and it tasted great. Concierge was also helpful. Very willing to set you up with their scheduled tour groups, taxis etc. The only drawback I would say about this hotel is that for a 5 star, the rooms were a bit small, but the service, location and all the other amenities made up for this shortcoming. I would definitely stay at this hotel next time I'm in Istanbul and would recommend it for someone who doesn't know the city very well and need a convenient, and easily recognizable hotel in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel worth its five star rating”
Reviews.Author: francoallemand
Reviews.Content: Only negative aspect, it's not really located close to the historic city center; You have to walk 20-30 minutes or take the tram next door. The hotel itself is typical to the big hotels of the group: the staff is friendly, the rooms are clean and the breakfast buffet is ok. Maybe the view isn't as nice as it should be expected in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but....”
Reviews.Author: COOKS76
Reviews.Content: the hotel has a very good service, it is well located in the old city, and they have taxi in front of the hotel all the time, but if you are looking for a fun and night life, it is not the location to be. the rooms are ok, a bit small, and most of the rooms have iner view at the lobby, and it is noisy. the breakfast is fine. all in all it is a not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: AshnaNED
Reviews.Content: It was a beautiful hotel in the old city of Istanbul close to a lot of tourist attractions like the Blue Mosk and Ayasofia and ofcourse the Grand Bazaar. All these locations can be reached by the tram that stops almost in front of the hotel. Taksim square can also be reached by tram and then metro very easily. Our room was big enougd for the two of us, only the bathroom was a bit on the small side, but clean and with everything you need. Also breakfast was ok. On the downside.....in the evening there is not alot to do around the hotel in terms of nightlife or good restauranst. So next we're in Istanbul we'll probably stay in a hotel in Taksim.

Reviews.Title: “Ok - but room for improvement!”
Reviews.Author: TheRealEngineer
Reviews.Content: If you stay at any chain of hotels you pretty much know what you are going to get. This Crowne Plaza ia a little different. It is 4 "wings" built around a central foyer. This foyer is actually quite impressive. The stay itself was marred by a few problems. What I assume is the main entrance has quite a few steps to climb - I didn't see any ramps / lifts (not to say of course they don't exist). This is not ideal if you have just got off a long flight and have several suitcases. To be fair, when the bell staff spotted us they were out quickly to help. We booked a double room with an extra rollaway bed. When we got to the room the extra bed was not present and it took 2 hours and several calls for it to be brought up. On the last day we asked for some extra tea bags and were told that there would be an extra charge! This is the first time this has happened to me in hundreds of hotel stays! Finally, also on the last day we asked for a late checkout which was agreed with the front desk. Just after the normal checkout time our key cards stopped working (not a complete shock but it would have been nice if they had mentioned we would need to bring the cards to reception to allow access after 12 noon). I don't want this review to come across as a spoilt brat moan (as some reviews do!) so I will say that on the positive side the room was a decent size and comfortable and close to a number of attractions including the Grand Bazaar. The Wi-Fi is lobby only but free and depending on the room you might get a signal. There is also a free business centre which was pretty good. Overall this hotel is fine unless you ask for something slightly outside the normal business requirements.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back again”
Reviews.Author: Helenecruise
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel on 3 occasions and what a pleasure. The staff are friendly, the rooms are lovely and spacious, but we always seem to get a corner room, which is even nicer. The breakfasts are wonderful so much fruit and fresh vegetables and one can really remain on such a healthy diet. The hotel is well situated and in easy walking distance to the Grand Bazaar and plenty shopping around the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Style”
Reviews.Author: Braguista
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, excellent location, clean, luxurious, all perfect... The only problem was temporary, the street in front of the hotel was in maintenance and we had to use a side door, passing thru a clothing store...

Reviews.Title: “Nice cover but poor content.”
Reviews.Author: Bordeaux71
Reviews.Content: Lousy location. Not a very accommodating staff. Weak breakfast buffet. Hot in lobby in summer. Some rooms noisy from street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: shell1952
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location as it is very close to the tram with easy access to all the sights. The staff were friendly and welcoming. The hotel is beautiful, room was good sized and we were allowed early check-in. The room was booked using priority club points and breakfast was not included. The breakfast offered was pricey and there was no complimentary coffee. For the going price of the rooms, it seems that breakfast should be included. Free soft drinks were offered from 4-7 pm but nothing else. There are lovely hotels closer to the old city and with a more reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “The right place to stay in the Old City!”
Reviews.Author: Coraat2011
Reviews.Content: Crown Plaza Old City is a somptuous Hotel placed in Old Istanbul, near to many beautiful places as Sulthanamet Place. It is not a cheap one. We stayed there as Priority Rewards Nights but when I looked at rates I thought you didn't get what you paied for. The corner room was at â‚¬ 500,00 per night. Big room, clean, spacious, but few amenities. The courtesy set didn't have no toothpaste nor tooth cleaner, the room was a twin bed room but one pair of slippers, no weightscale in the bathroom. The hotel is gorgeous in opulence and reminds in the structure an historical East Palace. The pool and the treatment SPA are nice, they are free for Hotel guest in the basics...still you don't feel warm...the hotel is very big and even if anyone were gentle to you, you don't feel warm in there. Ours was a two days trip and we didnt' had breakfast nor dinner...the taxi service is always ready at the door, around the corner the tram line goes straight to Sulthanamet...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: NefyTheodorou
Reviews.Content: My family and i decided to go on a trip in Istanbul. Some close friends told us that Crowne plaza is a great hotel. Finally we stayed 5 nights.The service was very friendly and polite. The rooms were very clean and we enjoyed our sleep such we didn't want to wake up. Fresh fruit,delicious sausages,marmalade and beaked bread were some of the tasty food that we ate in our breakfast.I also swam in the swimming pool and i really relaxed myself. A very beautiful shop which calls ''GIZIA'' is located there.We didn't buy anything because clothes were too expensive..but were very beautiful!! The view from our room was nice and generally all was excellent!!

Reviews.Title: “Warm Welcome”
Reviews.Author: Agy_10
Reviews.Content: Welll located. Warm staff always ready to assist. Gonul Comert, thank you for arranging a warm welcome.We had an early checked in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: MohamedExo
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in Crowne Plaza Istanbul for 8 nights in July 2011 , The hotel staff was good and polite specially they had accepted to do an early check-in for me at 8:00 am without extra charges , the Hotel is very clean and the service was good , breakfast is fresh and there is variety of choices specially fruits was great , gym and pool was good and Turkish bath was nice specially its for free , one of the negativity in the hotel i found is the long stairs in the entrance specially am having a baby stroller which i carried each time i go in and out of the hotel , anyway staff in the entrance was helping me carrying the stroller , the room size was small compared with 5 stars hotel standards ,anyway i didnt care about the room size as my main concern was the cleaning and the location of the hotel , both was perfect , location in Laleli Area near to the metro station "100m walking" and near to the grand bazaar and many attraction in the old istanbul and i recommend this hotel to people who wanna stay in a 5 stars hotel in a calm area and near metro stations and tourist attractions , by the way there is very few 5 stars hotel in old city area and this hotel is having a very reasonable prices compared to the others which are mostly far away from the old city "most of them in the Asian side which i dont recommend to tourists", my overall rating will be 4 out of 5

Reviews.Title: “We would love to come back”
Reviews.Author: Peter6151
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night after a cruise. Excellent location, good service, great room, good breakfast; what more could you want. Easy walking to major sites and plent of restaurants

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the Old City of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: RoySingh
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Crowne Plaza, Old City, Istanbul, great hotel, great service and ambiance and close to all major historical sites. The hotel is close to the local tramway stop of Laleli, walking distance to the Grand Bazaar, shopping areas, restuarants and Camberlita Spa. The facilities at the hotel (standard of room; beds; bedding; bath etc are new and very tastefully done) - spacious and a real treat for relaxing after a tiring day touring. The only downside is language as you need to communicate in Turkish - or pay th price. The conceirge who arranged our taxi was not very transparent regarding the taxi fare and as a result we found ourselves driving around a long route which was not necessary - at a higher fare!!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: gingerLiss
Reviews.Content: Booked through Priority Club Web site and selected a which had some extras such a drink on arrival, wine and chocolates in room. These were not offered and were not delivered after complaining to reception. The staff are not friendly and never smile. The Club Lounge was not available and was locked the whole time of visit. Offered freed drinks at bar but only between 4 and 7 each afternoon. Package included a free meal and wine in restaurant, but menu was so unapealling we decided to pass on this. There are so many excelent reataurants in Istanbul. Used the free swim and massage, but massage was spoiled by maseuse asking for tip nearly all of the time. Free wireless internet available but very poor reception in executive room. Hotel IT guy could not help and didn't solve problem.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location, not family friendly”
Reviews.Author: Cpoulter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in April before a road trip around Turkey. We used our priority club points and got upgraded to a lovely corner room for the 3 of us. (2 plus 1). Priority club members get complimentary soft drinks in the afternoon in the bar which is nice but you need to keep reminding the waiters especially when you get the bill! Which is embarassing! There is a lovely pool area including spa and I had a lovely hammam however our 2 year old daughter wasn't let in the pool - as it is "hotel policy" not to let under 4's use the pool. I don't know why and this was really disapointing for us as we'd particularly picked this hotel for this facility and had promised our daughter a swim after all the shopping and sightseeing. She has swam since 4 months old so don't quite understand the rationale for this. The location is great for all the big sites and our hire car sat in the car park for the duration of our stay - not bad considering the traffic in Istanbul. All in all a good stay but we wouldn't return as a family.

Reviews.Title: “Over Priced for nothing!”
Reviews.Author: MichelAlbert
Reviews.Content: Only because it is in Old Istanbul this hotel has nothing realy to offer. Rooms are small, boring and service is not so good. Compare to other Crowne in the world this one is way too expensive. Also if you are an Ambassador and/or gold Member with Intercontinental and Crowne... you won't get the service you are expecting. The ''spa'' is terrible. Try to find another place to stay and avoid this one. Internet is for free... but just try to get a connection you will see what i mean.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, good location both for tourists and business travellers”
Reviews.Author: OSNT-DXB
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a converted old palace or something like that. Good location within walking distance from old bazaar, public transport and plenty of shops in front of the hotel. They provided free valet parking for my rental car. Perfect place for business and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay here”
Reviews.Author: Pudditat
Reviews.Content: Staff was great and gave us an upgraded room (large). The room was beautifully decorated and we overlooked the street where we could watch vendors preparing gyros and other treats. The area is OK but not a short walk to the sites we wanted to see. Although they were happy to tell us how to use the tram, we didn't. The hotel is well decorated and pleasant, but the bar and restaurant are expensive. Each night I went out on the street and brought food back, which was nice as we got to try the local fare. We had a small balcony and could sit out and watch the evening come over us.

Reviews.Title: “"Had everything we wanted."”
Reviews.Author: bettejohn
Reviews.Content: A number of tour groups stay at the Crowne Plaza. We were part of one and I didn't know much about the area or the hotel before we arrived and was pleased to find the location was on a tram line (trams are easy to take in Istanbul) and also within walking distance (15 - 20 min.) of the Blue Mosque, the Aga Sofia, Topkapi and many, many restaurants. Our room was not overly spacious, but was nicely furnished. We stayed twice, once on arriving for a few nights, and once at the end of our stay the day before returning to Boston. Our first room was a "handicapped" room probably because of the hotel being full. Our last room was in a different section but very similar. The hotel is made up of 4 buildings organized around a central interior courtyard. There are separate elevators for each building. The breakfast buffet is extensive and includes Turkish dishes as well as more Western food. We have an IPad and were able to get that to work with the hotel's wireless connection (free). There was a mini bar which we didn't use. The hotel provides two bottles of water per day free. We ate dinner (with the tour group) in the hotel the first evening and the meal was fine, though there are many places to eat in Istanbul that are more interesting.

Reviews.Title: “hotel made for large groups”
Reviews.Author: friederike_ch
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a business trip in this hotel for a week. My first impression has been that it is a hotel for big bus travel groups with the average age of 70 years. Hence, the food is quite european and without any spices. The breakfast is big but made for English traveler or sweet adicts. The swimming pool and the Spa is little compared to other hotels in Istanbul. the location is great. Near to the tram, grand bazar and sea. My room was a single bedroom on the top floor. That means I had no real windows - 30 cm from the floor. I had no table for doing my work in the evening. The wlan access worked okay. Advise: Ask before that you will get a quite room (mosque next to the buidling) and a room with real windows. The concierge is extremly friendly and helpful, whereas the ladies at the reception need some education in treating guest politely. The entrance hall is huge and impressive. The restaurant is okay. Summary: The place is okay for big traveler groups and tourists, not really for business.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: LondonGirlFriday
Reviews.Content: Large hotel close to the Bazaar. Our friends were given a room much larger than ours which was annoying. Clean, comfortable (if small) rooms. Didn't spend much time in the hotel as there was so much to see and do. Recommended hotel for a weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Istanbul!!!”
Reviews.Author: Demetres
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Crowne Plaza Old City in Istanbul will be unforgettable and one of the reasons is the hotel we chose. It's location is perfect for shopping and site seeing. The food and service is great, as always in Crowne Plaza hotels, but the most impressive about this hotel is the beauty of the building and the interior decoration which is without words!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful,and great location!”
Reviews.Author: EmilyRedDeer
Reviews.Content: Reception staff were very friendly. Was a quaint hotel room very nicely decorated.The location was great, transit right outside your door. If you enjoy walking it is about a 20-30 minute walk to Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Topaki palace. Lots of shopping right around hotel but found out lots of shops were wholesale shops.But some were willing to sell to you anyways. Just 10 minute walk to Grand Bazzar, that was CRAZyY busy, and spice market is also very close. Lots of walking,but was great to be right at the heart of it all.Would highly reccomend this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the midst of busy Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: casjf
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel that is an oasis after the hustle and bustle of Istanbul. We had a big city-sized small room and small bathroom. Nicely decorated with amenities you would expect of a higher end hotel, including a health club and pool and nice bar. The restaurant has a limited, mostly lunch-like American menu -- you'll want to eat dinner elsewhere, especially given the prices. If you are handicapped or have issues with stairs (as I did after I sprained my ankle on the way back from the Chora Church), this hotel will be challenging. There are stairs up to the lobby and then down again to get to each bank of rooms. Elevators will take you to your floor, but you'll still need to take stairs to get to the elevator. To give the illusion of a larger room, our room had windows extending out on 3 sides in the shape of the top part of a hexagon. The peculiar angle meant that the curtains did not reach the end of the windows so when the sun rose, even with the curtains closed, the rising sun shone exactly across our pillows. Plan to wake early in the summer if your room faces east. Free Internet was a plus. The bar staff and doormen were very professional and helpful. Location is a shopping district, so not many restaurants. You'll need to go elsewhere for nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: summerlea45
Reviews.Content: Very smart and clean hotel - if you can not do steps - avoid - about 20 in total to get to reception/ rooms - found staff very helpful and polite - did not do breakfast - looked ok but pricey. Location 5 mins down hill or 5 mins up hill to Tram - 15 mins walk or 5 mins on tram) to Grand Bazzar - 10 mins on Tram to all the other main sites. 15 mins gentle up hill walk to other main mosque Suleymanie (well worth it). Has a very small gym - enough for 2 and small pool, steam room (when working) and suana (all free) - all in basement - no direct access - accross lobby in dressing gown.....if no one using great if more than three or 4 feels pretty full. Not really an area really for strolling round in the evenings if looking for restaurants but plenty of choice elsewhere on the tram line e.g. Sultanamet - but if you want clothes, shoes and handbags - lots and lots of local shops

Reviews.Title: “A wee jewel in the Crowne”
Reviews.Author: champagneannie
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were celebrating one of my friends special birthdays . We wanted a hotel near the sights of a good standard to suit sight seeing by day and dining at night . The Crowne Plaza ticked all the boxes. The entrance and atrium are lovely. The staff are friendly and helpful .The breakfast was good for a continental one with lots of choice. (The diets didn't last long with the pastries and turkish delight) We got a great deal on the Crowne Plaza website including breakfast so didn't find it expensive. The hotel felt very safe and the bar had friendly helpful bar staff and reasonable priced drinks. The only downside is I feel the rooms are scheduled for decoration. ,They were a little dark with some of the wood stained .What I would however add is they were clean ,good beds which were welcomed after all the sightseeing. The hotel was in a good location near the university (also near the main fashion district ,great ladies shops ,shoes ,shoes and more shoes.) The tram was great and was only a short walk from the hotel. We used it regularly as it was quite wet outside. Istanbul is a great city to get around .The people were very friendly and helpful. (Thanks to everyone on Istanbul Forum for all their hints beforehand.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: andreas02
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, not far from AyaSofia and Topkapi palace. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel good, staff and breakfasts left a lot to be desired.”
Reviews.Author: Bigbucksandco
Reviews.Content: The hotel seemed great, it was situated in the old city and close to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia museum and the Topkapi Palace museum. Also the Grand Bazaar. The room was spacious and clean and 2 bottles of water were provided daily. We were unable to book accommodation including breakfast so had to pay locally. The breakfast worked out at Â£14 each per day and was very poor value. The hot food consisted of "half boiled eggs" fried eggs on one day, as well as some sort of sausage pieces like frankfurter sausages. Also a cheese pie. The "hot" food was always cold even though we complained to the restaurant staff. We also complained as we checked out but they were indifferent to us. The cold food was a little cheese and cold processed meat. Bread rolls and fruit were ok as well as plates of Turkish Delight. Although this was a self service buffet meal, the staff expected to be tipped for their service, which we did not see! The staff went about their jobs with little facial expression and never any greetings of Good morning/evening etc.Even though they spoke reasonably good English they did not want to engage in conversation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a city break with friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Gen25_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Crowne Plaza and thought it was lovely. It has a nice cosy feel especially over Christmas. The rooms were a good size and everywhere was very clean. The staff were extremely helpful with recomendations and directions. The location is perfect, within walking distance of all main attrations and the metro which is easy to use. Our stay included breakfast which was not the usual 5* spread but sufficiant with choices of continental and fresh fruit, tea and coffee etc. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: RetiredofWeymouth
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for five nights on a city break to celebrate my partner's birthday. We were both very impressed by the high standards set by the hotel and by the genuine friendliness of the staff. There had been some criticism of the quality of the reception and concierge in other reviews but we found both most helpful and efficient. We were made welcome from the moment we arrived until the moment we left and nothing was too much trouble for anyone. The location of the hotel is perfect and we were able to either walk or take the tram to all the many attractions that Istanbul has to offer. The breakfasts were fantastic - both in terms of quality and quantity. We sometimes ate in the hotel in the evenings and sometimes we went out to nearby restaurants. Dinner in the hotel was always a real treat and the service was outstanding. The hotel is on the corner of a busy street and a minor street and our room overlooked the latter but had views of the busy one. There was a mosque just opposite. But the double glazing managed to mute the sounds of both the traffic (which seemed to come to a standstill and perform a concert on the horn every morning and evening) and the morning call to prayer so that neither disturbed us in the slighest. We travel frequently and I don't usually write reviews but we enjoyed our stay here so much that I felt we had to pass it on to others who might be thinking about staying here. If you enjoy your stay half as much as we enjoyed ours you will have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: stelios_UK70
Reviews.Content: A typical Crowne Plaza hotel. Nice rooms although a bit small. I stayed for 6 nights and although my room was serviced every day, the carpet was not hoovered at all during my stay which I think it was not acceptable. Also as a platinum priority club member I expected to receive a welcome gift, usually some chocolates, a basket of fruit and some wine. This is the norm especially if you stay for more than 3 nights. I had a great fruit basket, chocolates and a small bottle of wine when I stayed at the Crowne Plaza in Ankara but never at the one in Istanbul and I have stayed there 3 times already. Location is excellent with tram station only a couple of minutes walk from the main entrance.

Reviews.Title: “All you can expect from a 5 star hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: Kyriaki
Reviews.Content: It was a very enjoyable stay at the Crowne Plaza hotel . Price was a bargain !! 85 euros ( room only ) Standard twin room : spacious , nicely decorated and very quiet . Free wireless internet ( rather slow , though ) Free: indoors swimming pool , fitness area and last but not to be missed the steam room !! Staff adequate for a hotel at this standard Bar and restaurant ,rather expensive , but classy and well appointed !! 15 minutes walking to Grand Bazaar. Three tram stops to Sultanahmet. Certainly an excellent choice .

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service for the price”
Reviews.Author: anwaar_farooqi
Reviews.Content: We had booked 2 separate rooms - one for kids and one for parents. In spite of my request in advance acknewledged by the hotel, the rooms allocated were far apart and we were told that we are lucky that we got rooms on the same floor. Allocated rooms were smoking when it was in my priority club portfolio that I prefer non-smoking rooms. Smoking rooms for kids!!! What a joke. Rude staff at reception - nothing worth the name of smile or courtesy. Wrote to priority club who referred the matter back to the hotel from where a formal apology was received. As a platinum level member, it was another shocking attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Dolores2107
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on our first trip to Istanbul and we loved it. It was definitely the highlight of our stay. The location, the design, the staff, the breakfast... everything was great! Small issue with the in-room safe though...but it didn't spoil our stay. I would definitely recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel/Wonderful City”
Reviews.Author: rcajun
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here during the last week of December and we totally enjoyed our visit. The hotel is really nice and the location is not bad. It is an uphill walk to all of the attractions such as the Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, etc but they are not far away, 15 minutes at the most. The Tram stop is only a block away and other than it always being extremely crowded it is great to use.. Our room was wonderful and roomy. The bathroom was big and the shower was very good.and we were even upgraded to a queen room without having to ask. The front desk personnel and staff in the evening were very friendly and helpful. The gentleman who took our bags to our room was also very friendly. The hotel interior is beautiful, the workout room and pool area was great. This is a very nice hotel. There are plenty of little stores and Kebab shops nearby. The little Kebab store directly across the street from the hotel was very good and very inexpensive. Istanbul is a wonderful city and very interesting and intriguing. We hope to be able to return soon and will definitely stay at the Crowne Plaza again. It was a wonderful week at a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal staff; perfect location and amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: PHDMMW
Reviews.Content: I have been in over 50 countries and have never stayed in a better hotel.......perfect for vacation or business! Incredible service and best location for sightseeing in the city! My highest recommendation!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel for the Old City”
Reviews.Author: BostonBen
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a relatively good location. There are many hotels that are more central in the Old City that are fine and more local, but none as grand as the Crowne Plaza. And the location is not bad-- it is a 10-15 minute walk to the Grand Bazaar and probably another 10-15 to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. Inside the hotel, the lobby is a spectacular atrium connecting the four wings of the hotel. There's a restaurant and lots of holiday decorations in the spacious public area. The rooms are small and not designed for business-- small desks, chairs with no backs-- but comfortable enough. The staff was pleasant and helpful until I tried to check out early in the morning, when the bellhop told me the desk clerk was taking a break and I couldn't check out until he returned. This is not what you want to hear when you're trying to catch a morning flight. it took over 10 minutes of waiting for the desk clerk to return, during which time I tried to leave but was implored not to by the desperate bellhop. This experience was the only notable negative of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but bad service”
Reviews.Author: DXB_Maple
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights as part our vacation. The best part of this hotel is the location. It is a short walk to the main old city and even shorter walk to the tram that can take you all over the city. The hotel is situated with many restaurants nearby. The location is excellent. The rooms are well furnished and cleaned well every day by the cleaning staff. Our room was located in the 1st block and on the 3rd floor. Our room was very quiet and we really could not complain at all. The staff at the reception desk and concierge desk are awful and in desperate need of some customer service training. When asked for simple information we were told quiet rudely that it was not possible and no offer to help in any regard. We resorted to outside help or internet help to solve our inquiries. After eating breakfast for a couple days we were bored of the same selection of breakfast choices. I would suggest looking outside the hotel for breakfast (there are many nice pastry shops on the main street). Finally, the gym, as stated in other reviews does not open until 8am. This is not convenient to travelling guests. We were experiencing a little bit of jet lag and were up relatively early some mornings and we would have used the gym but it was not open. With lots work on customer service, this hotel could be great!

Reviews.Title: “You can get much better than this”
Reviews.Author: OVS83
Reviews.Content: Service was low, very limited boring breakfast buffet, rooms were small (very small for a 5*), staff were NOT friendly (they were in fact looking for a reason to snap at you!!) and worst of all is their concierge!! They had no clue about any thing. They recommended places that were closed down for months and we found only out after paying for a long drive with taxi. Very Very low level of information about the most basic stuff in the city! The tour they arranged for us was so bad that I had more info about the historical places than the tour leader! 4th Floor of the hotel doesnt have an elevator and the check-in staff actually trick you to take it ! Without telling you, they give you a room there and you wouldnt know untill you are up and too late to change! Thats cheating!! And to top it off - if you still plan to go after all, DO NOT GET A MASSAGE ! it will leave you in horrible pain ! they just dont know any thing about massages

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the good location”
Reviews.Author: ttrepelk
Reviews.Content: We spend 3 nights in Istanbul in transit to Israel. Traveling with friends 3 couples stayed 3 nights in Crowne Plaza. We enjoyed our stay and all of us agreed that this was a good choice for hotel in Istanbul. Hotel is located in the old European area of the city and is close to all main attractions. We walked to Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar,St.Sophia (Hagia Sohpia). The rooms are clean and comfortable. Free WiFI was a nice feature. We requested non-smoking room but all our rooms were smoking. Apparently there are very few non-smoking rooms in hotel and you need to contact hotel n advance to make sure you can get one. However, 2 out of 3 rooms were acceptable and we didn't have to change the room. The front desk attendants were very helpful and offered us several options for the third room until we found the room that did not smell like cigarette smoke. The beds were very comfortable and bathrooms had good showers. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant but there were always people there during breakfast and dinner. We had found couple of small and less expensive cafes in the area for breakfast and restaurants for dinner. I would stay in this place again and would recommend it to a friend

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Trippper123
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four night at the end of September 2010! I would exactly say it was great but it ticked most of the relevant boxes that needed to be ticked on a short break! The breakfast was good, service a little somber but it was ok! I would recommend it but don't go expecting the world as you'd be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Upscale hotel.”
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice; a total of 5 nights. Helpful staff; convenient location; excellent breakfast, free internet. You might want to check your room out before moving in. On our second stay we were in a different block and had the smallest bathroom imaginable. There are a lot of steps for the porters that they must carry suitcases up from the street. On the second stay we could hear the street noise late at night as party goers walked up and down. To reach the swimming pool meant walking through the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “new hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: ukjofer
Reviews.Content: the hotel is new and therefore its rooms are in excellent condition. The hall is designed as atrium, so some rooms outlook inside the atrium not outside. Glass lifts are pretty cool. The hotel is situated next to Lali University / tram stop so getting there and around is not a problem. The breakfast was OK. The service was also good, we had to ask the receptionist for a couple of things and they were delivered to our room promptly.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to be, if for a Short Visit to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Shah_Chirag
Reviews.Content: Very much centrally located and beautiful Hotel. All the gems of Istanbul are just stone throw away from this Hotel. Very Good service and a quiet atmosphere made our day in the lovely city of Istanbul. We just stayed there for a very short period of two days, but the stay experience was very good except we had to wait till 13.00 to get check in to the room as the hotel was running full. The staff was courteous enough and served us some drinks and snacks for the meanwhile. The rooms are big enough and plush with very good amenities and the one which we admired the most were the soft and cushionly beds. had the best sleep. The bathroom were welll stocked with the luxurious toileteries and the mini bar in the room was stocked with best wines. We would definitely come back to this hotel for our next visit to Istanbul. On the whole a great hotel offering real value for money....................

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Lasse70
Reviews.Content: We stayed at your Hotel from 4th to 7th of October and and wrote three post-cards for our good friends in Finland. We left the cards with stamps at your reception desk but so far no one of our friends haven't got our greetings from Istanbul. Is it possible that our cards are still at the reception desk or does the post from Istanbul to Helsinki take more than two weeks. Flight to Helsinki airport by Finnair took 2 h 45 min.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Central and well run”
Reviews.Author: EnglandD&B
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights with small group of 10 to see the sights! This was a well placed hotel central to the old quarter, modernised to high standard and offering spacious accommodation. The spacious main reception area had a good cafe and bar for snacks with an adjoining a la carte restaurant for good choice international dishes. The main dining rooms were buffet style for residents breakfast and group meals - busy in peak hours but well staffed and good selection of food. Staff throughout good and caring - a lot of help available from concierge desk. A Good centre for the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience at the Crowne Plaza- Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: sailorann
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at the Crowne Plaza hotel- Old City in Istanbul between September 27th- October 3rd. From the airport the taxi ride costs about $30 Lira. There are many stories about the taxi's ripping you off, we ended up booking an airport transfer to and from the hotel, which costs about â‚¬70. Very expensive in my opinion. While there are trains from the airport to the Sirkeci train station, it is not close to the hotel. I would recommend taking a taxi to the airport. The hotel was fantastic. The interior has the elegance and charm of what you would expect from Turkey. The rooms were quite nice. A nice flat screen TV and all mod con's. The rooms were a bit smaller than we were used too. The only thing that was a bit disappointing was the bathrooms were rather small, even for a petite person like myself, it was hard to move around in there. The rooms also had no bathtub, only a shower which was very nice and spacious. Our room didn't really have a view, but was not loud so you could get a good night's sleep after all that walking! We also had breakfast included in our package. It was excellent. The selection of foods you are presented with allows everyone to be satisfied. The food is all halal, so it was good. Foods range from Turkish teas, a variety of breads, pastries, eggs, sausages, fruit, cheeses, yoghurt, olives, cold cuts, etc. The food was also very good. A definite plus! The staff at the restaurant were also very good and helpful. The hotel is well situated. It's on a small street that turns into a main road. The main road is filled with shops and the tram stop is right in front of the hotel. If you like to walk you can enjoy all of the shops, restaurants and small kebap shops. The Grand Bazaar is about 10 minutes walking from the hotel. You can also walk to many of the main attractions from the hotel. The Haiga Sophia and the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace are all within walking distance from the hotel. Istanbul is definitely one of those cities where you have to walk around to really appreciate the city. You can get lost and find new little back street ally's, bazaarâ€™s. The walk back to the hotel at night is also very safe; since it's a busy street we didn't feel unsafe at any time. There is also a lot of security at the hotel so it's very safe. We also tried out the swimming pool, sauna and stream room. All three were fantastic. The hotel also offers Turkish Bath services, but we did ours at the Cemberlitas Bath, which you can also walk to from the hotel. I didn't find the concierge very helpful. When we asked questions, we were provided with some quick answers, so I didn't bother asking any other questions. Also if you try to book a transfer from the hotel to the airport it will cost around â‚¬40. I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. It was almost a shame to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: mooikut
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the Laleli district, which is a very ideal location. Tram will take you to the Grand Bazaar and Sultanahmet area. Both stops are within 10 minutes and very inexpensive. I found this hotel on Luxurygroup website. They have restaurant and bar on premises. The hotel is in a busy area so some rooms can be noisy, but its much better than being stuck in some faraway place. I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and good helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: bazandbabs24
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and was allocated a corner room in block 1. Room was spacious with large flat screen TV, very comfortable beds, great bathroom too. Staff were very helpful and friendly. The hotel is set up into 4 blocks linked together under a large atrium. To get to the room you could either take the lift or walk through the breakfast area (which was a little odd). Good gym, swimming pool and spa - would highly recommend the Turkish hammam there! Any gripes? The room was quite dark and the curtains were actually too small and didn't quite fit the window! Otherwise good location and would recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice all-around; just select your room carefully”
Reviews.Author: 7ContinentsX
Reviews.Content: This is a good choice overall for business or vacation. I consider the location, hotel rooms and overall "feeling" of the hotel to be good, with a couple caveats. I would stay here again. Location: It's about 200 m to the tram stop, which is only 4 stops (5 min) from the heart of the Old Town. (You can also walk it in 15+ minutes, a straight shot down a major road.) There are plenty of smaller hotels closer to the heart of the Old City, so if this "commute" is not ideal for you, consider looking a little harder for one of those boutique / smaller places. The immediate neighborhood is busy and seems geared to locals shopping for clothes and goods, not really to tourists. Set-up: the hotel was originally a block of four apartment buildings (the most modern in the city at the time) and they've done a very nice job joining them under an atrium. During the summer it can be very hot in the common area downstairs; it doesn't seem like the AC is strong enough for the large area. In winter I assume this won't be an issue. The hotel is very attractive. Room selection: I STRONGLY recommend telling reception you do NOT want a Room in "Block 2". Most of the rooms in Block 2 open onto the dining area for breakfast, and it can be loud and there isn't much privacy. I've seen 3 - 4 other rooms in other blocks and the set-up is different for each. If you're not happy with the assigned room, consider asking to see another. The staff was accommodating on this front. Breakfast / restaurants: Not very good. I stopped eating the breakfast even though it was free. Concierge: I have stayed in 5 - 6 other hotels in Istanbul and found the level of knowledge and creativity to be lower than most. They seemed to focus on group tours and had a small number of options / distributors. I found most of the useful info online and with the concierge of a hotel I'd stayed in previously. The CP staff was helpful for restaurant reservations however. Meetings: Acceptable, though I'd suggest you confirm that AC will be adequate for the group. The AC was completely off in a couple of the rooms we used for hours, and I wouldn't be surprised if the temp in the room was 90+ F.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: TravelingDiva51
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a GREAT location in the Old City of Istanbul - there is a tram stop around the corner from the hotel (the tram takes you to all of the main tourist sites in the city, and is easy to use, though very crowded). Only about a 6-7 minute walk from the Grand Bazaar. Rooms were clean, beds were comfortable, hotel was pretty quiet. Free internet at the business center was a nice surprise! The staff was OK - the concierge was pretty useless, couldn't figure out how to help with purchasing event tickets or anything. The restaurant was just OK - very overpriced for drinks/dinner. Breakfast buffet was OK - enough variety so you can certainly find something decent. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT STAY”
Reviews.Author: Janssen_10
Reviews.Content: If anybody would ever suggest a city trip to Istanbul I strongly advise this 5 star rated hotel Location of the hotel is that perect that major attractions like Gand Bazaar - Blue Mosque - Aya Sophiaand Topkapi Palace are on walking distance, altough hotel has its own taxi service 24 hrs a day Room was very modern and clean with enough space Staff is amazing and service level is that high and also 24 hrs a day

Reviews.Title: “Poor Standard room with air conditioned too low and no windows to open !!”
Reviews.Author: Sindec
Reviews.Content: Was in this hotel for 4 nights !!! Very close to the old town. The hotel entrance is good, old furnishing but excellent style. Front desk people not good, too much sophisticated but do not speak italian !! (I speak 5 language) they do not hear your need and problems !!! two times we've told to change the room or resolve the problem to the air conditiong system too low. but no one resolved !!! The Room was a standard but in a roof floor, I don't know why !!! with no open windows, so the air conditioning was too low and had trouble to sleep !! No remote control for air conditioning !!! Incredible was a 5 stars... so was hard to sleep having had to much stomach problems for air strikes...plus when you go out of the room the a/c system reset and restart from 16Â° and this is too low !!! No one Italian channel on tv, and this is an international hotel !!! I ask at the front desk for this and they have put only ONE !!! Incredible service !!! The breakfast was normal, not excellent for a 5 stars !!! trouble to have fresh croissants and orange juice at 9,30 as was finish and no more available !!! (I've ask two times for and same answer had, no more sorry.... was too late for the chief, 9,30 !!!) So please weak up early if you want the fresh croissants !!!
