(the breakfast close at 10,30 !! but at 9,30 croissants and orange juise are finish !! incredible) Just Sauna and TurkishBath was ok, swimming pool to small.... price for dinner and coffee to high !!! 7 euro for two normal expresso !!! Incredible prices... Not recommended for holidays... they look you in the front desk looked you with enough !! was better the baggage guys more smiling !!

Reviews.Title: “Missing some things”
Reviews.Author: scadroes
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza was a nice looking clean hotel. The rooms were very large and the location is good as it is in the Old City right next to the tram. It was easy to get around from here but it was about a 5-10 min ride from the major historical sites. The room and bathroom were very clean. Now for some of the negatives: 1. The bed had a comforter but no sheet. 2. The breakfast was mediocre at best. The selection was large but the quality and taste was poor. 3. The service was average. We asked for robes and they never brought them. We also tried to get change for some money on Sunday morning and they didn't have any since it was Sunday. Overall it was a comfortable hotel but is was missing some elements.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel to escape the bustle of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: hbuckley
Reviews.Content: A great location next to the trams mean you can see the sights very easily. We got a good deal when booking otherwise it would have been out of our budget. The swimming pool and spa is all very welcome after walking round Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Nice big rooms”
Reviews.Author: traveller2255
Reviews.Content: I have stayed with my four kids for 6 nights end of july 2010 atthis hotel. My kids the suite and myself with my wife stayed at a corner room. The hotel is a big hotel relative to the location. The hotel is split into four building blocks. Very nice and uncommon set up. The lobby area is very beautiful. the rooms are big compairing to other hotels. Shops are spread all around the hotel. It took my family around 20 minutes to reach the Grand Bazaar by foot It is in my opinion a 4 stars hotel. definatly not 5. The service of the staff is basic. | would compair it to the service you get from an air plane crew. I didnt like there attitute most of the time. They dont smile. They make you wait for a long time before even looking at you. but I must say that they do demonsrate the basic proffessional behavior. I had a couple of negative issues with the tour operator booked thru the hotel. Swimming pool is small. Stay at this hotel if you are not too picky about a hotel staff service. Internet wireless connection waas was and free.

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish hotel but with unprofessional staff”
Reviews.Author: llauraa-
Reviews.Content: I can't mention any fault what comes to the atmosphere, design or outlook of the hotel. Location is great, short distance from top sights like Aya Sophya and Sultanahmet Mosque. The hotel looks very clean and sophisticated from outside, no complaints about it, but especially the reception area is very impressive. It really creates of feeling that you are living in a five star hotel. Our room type was King suite and we were very happy with it. It was spacious, consisting two bedrooms and two bathrooms, both rooms equipped with huge TVs. What comes to services of the hotel, the pool and gym were both very modern and tidy. Free internet room was almost always empty and we had no problems with the connection. Breakfast surely satisfies even the most demanding guest. There were different sorts of traditional turkish yoghurts and sweets that we liked a lot. About the staff.. I wouldn't claim them being rude, just unknown. When arriving to hotel, we were taken to 4 basic rooms before they finally showed us our suite which was some 3 times bigger than the basic one. Maybe it was just a mistake, not cheating, but it felt a bit awkward. The room price should have included both breakfast and some afternoon snacks but the staff claimed they had never heard about that kind of offers (even though we booked the room from hotel's official website). The worst thing was when we were leaving and they told us we had some 900 euros bill to their restaurant even though we hadn't even visited there during our stay. Finally they believed us but the feeling we had when leaving the hotel was a bit uncomfortable. I hope no other guests need to experience that kind of treatment. Without those problems with staff I would still definitely recommend this hotel for everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel in Old City Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: debbie341
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaze, Old City Istanbul is a true gem! While the architecture, lobby and rooms may not wow you...the ambiance and outstanding service will!!! My friend and I - two middle aged women traveling without our husbands - never felt an uneasy minute thanks to the unparalleled treatment we received from every single hotel staff member. Their restaurant recommendations were stellar and they even made sure we were picked up or they delivered us to our destination themselves. When we picked up some frozen manti, the chef prepared it for us just the way my friend's grandmother used to...and then did not even charge us for the preparation! I simply cannot rave enough about the hotel's service...from the very friendly GM, who took every advantage to speak to us...to the front desk manager/concierge, Kadir, who was just a delight. The hotel was within easy walking district of the Grand Bazaar (Istanbul's shopping mecca) and an inexpensive cab ride to most other must-see attractions. My only caveat for comfort was the hotel's location across the street from a mosque. As my friend and I generally closed down the lobby bar, a 4ish am broadcast of the call to prayer sent me running to the pharmacy to buy earplugs. The first morning it was most interesting. The remaining mornings...not so much. Ask for a room that doesn't face the street. Overall, I would highly recommend the Crowne Plaza and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: UnderSeige
Reviews.Content: What a nice surprise this hotel was, especially after trying to find a nice hotel That could accommodate four guests in one room. The hotel is walking distance to all main tourists attractions, and anything a little further you wish to get to, the tram is no more then a few hundred meters away. The hotel service was as good as any five star hotel I have stayed at. This hotel is very classy and very well priced and I would have no hesitation recommending it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Super Old City Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: RalphPriorsMarston
Reviews.Content: This is a modern but traditionally designed hotel located ideally for the main attractions such as Grand Bazaar which is easily walkable and a little further The Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia Super cheap trams if you would prefer to use them Great service throughout including providing an interpreter to help at the police station when my friend had his wallet picked(could happen in any city in the world) Don't go on the Princes Island trip it is a god awful dump

Reviews.Title: “Return to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Miguel_Aparicio
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, 5 minutes walking from the Gran Bazar and close to the major attractions. The welcome and check in process are very efficient and professional. The interior and lay out of the hotel are a perfect example of the use of pre-existing constructions, preservation and use the best possible of the space. Rooms are big and comfortable. In resume all that you need to have a good time in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Such a lovely peaceful room made me not want to go into the bussle that is Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Sapengro
Reviews.Content: I dislike gushing about hotels, but this one deserves gushing about. The room was spacious, modern, clean, shiny and new. The bed was huge, the shower was like being in a tropical rainforest (minus the trees and animals. OK, I liked the shower!). Its close to the Old City and bazaar, but its so peaceful, a different world. And the unbelieveable price of Â£85 a night for this kind of luxury can't be beaten. Go there you won't be dissapointed. The only reason I didn't give this hotel full marks is that I had little to do with the staff so I have no opinion, but they seemed OK enough.

Reviews.Title: “Ok'ish.. I guess...”
Reviews.Author: PerfectStay
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the Crown Plaza located in the old city in Istanbul. The standard was ok. It had some signs that it had been worn, but overall the room was ok size and had what I expected to find in the room. The view from our room was zero. The location was central, but not as central as I expected from what I had read online. There is no problem at all walking to the major attractions in the old city, but it will take you some time and it can be very warm to walk outside. When it comes to service I had a very pleasant first impression by the young gentleman who showed us to our rooms, but everything after that was.. ok.. Would not rate it as a 5 star hotel, but maybe 4. Besides from really bad trafficâ€¦ everywhere Istanbul is a fantastic city and for this price I would recommend the hotel and probably stay here again if I was looking form something within the same budget range the next time I visit.. for there will be a next time ï�Š

Reviews.Title: “Next time in Istanbul I would only stay at the Crowne Plaza - Old City”
Reviews.Author: sandra1414
Reviews.Content: I returned to Crowne Plaza Istanbul as my sister and I were having 5 days together on a shopping and siteseeing holiday. I was at this hotel last year with my husband and son and hoped it would be as good this time. It was. The hotel room was excellent, the staff were excellent and I could not find fault with anything. In fact the beds were so comfortable I would have liked to take them home. To travel anywhere from the hotel is exceptional easy. There is a tram 2 minutes from the hotel that takes you around Istanbul making life very easy and if you are over 50 years old you are always given a seat on the tram by some kind person. I will coment on the shops outside the hotel. Unfortunately most of them are wholesale only even though we did find 3 or 4 that would serve us. Surely in a tourist area, especially a high street, it would be a good idea to have shops that tourists can go in and buy. I feel city holidays are for sites,museums etc. shopping and food. Go to Taksim for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful location and a top notch hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Nerva65
Reviews.Content: Book as far ahead as possible as the rates can escalate steeply for last minute travellers. Unless you are an early riser avoid the rooms near the mosque as the muezzin gives his first call at 04:30. There are plenty of restaurants nearby so you are not wedded to the hotel's facilities, excellent thought they are.

Reviews.Title: “Great location spoilt by the bad attitude of the staff”
Reviews.Author: Ebby1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel before (unfortunately!) checking on Trip Advisor and reading all the useful reviews. Well, where to start... 1) Check-in: We were given a room on the fourth floor which was TINY, and not what the pictures had shown when we initially booked the room. It had a strong musty smell, and when I asked to be moved, the receptionist was SO rude, and without even checking on the computer, said they had no other rooms. The bathroom had no bath, just a small shower, and there were no toiletries available. One half of the room was inaccesible to my husband because (at 6'3), he would hit his head on the sloping ceiling. 2) Breakfast: Expensive, and very limited. Breakfast wasn't included in our package so we had to pay 33TL (equivalent of Â£16.50) per person for what you can get in a 3* European Hotel. Once things finished, they weren't refilled so it was your tough luck if you wanted a lie-in. The only saving grace was the cleaning staff, who were great. But it definitely wasn't worth the money we spent, and we won't be staying there again when we go back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “For a recently opened 5 star hotel the...”
Reviews.Author: NateCambs
Reviews.Content: For a recently opened 5 star hotel the soundproofing is terrible. Road noise until the early hours and then the mosque call to prayer and then the road again :-( my bathroom was also tiny. Service was not very friendly with a couldn't care less attitude. Avoid the hotel taxi too!

Reviews.Title: “Everything up to scratch and more!”
Reviews.Author: KenBarns
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, fantastic breakfasts. Of course, given the price, there would be no excuses for anything less. The location was a little way from the usual hotel districts, but Sultanahmet, the Grand Bazaar, and the Spice Bazaar could all be reached within an hour's walk, which was perfectly acceptable (even preferable) for us. The location around the hotel itself had an interesting selection of markets, restaurants, shops, etc to explore, and a cheap tram station to Sultanahmet and Taksim was less than 100m away. My wife particularly loved the inexpensive textiles district immediately to the south - and picked up a leather jacket for 140TL! Rooms were very comfortable. The nearest mosque (about 50m away) was close enough to make the early call to prayer clearly audible, but we found this quite charming. At least the muezzin here was comparatively tuneful, unlike some of the wounded bull bellows we heard elsewhere. Service was helpful, but impersonal - once again, to be expected given the size and nature of the hotel. We didn't notÄ±ce any of the rudeness that others have pointed out. Overall, a wonderful hotel. Only significant minus was a tariff that would normally be out of our price range (were we not with a group). A great way to start our trip through Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the centre of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Euergetes
Reviews.Content: We had a suite, so our teenage daughter could have a sofa-bed in a separate room and our younger son was on a camp bed in the (huge) double bedroom, without breaking the bank. Rooms were richly decorated, bathroom consumables were top quality, there were plasma TVs in both rooms, and the suite was at the back of the hotel so it was wonderfully quiet at night. The public spaces were fantastic - the hotel is composed of four city residential buildings united and roofed over with glass so the ex-streets in between the blocks form soaring atria, with reception, cafe and high class shops on the 'street' level. Breakfast consists of all the usual cooked and continental, plus local specialities such as Turkish porridge, which is scrumptiously different from British, what we call 'Greek' salad, and halva, for example. The spa is open long hours, and has a small but adequate swimming pool - a rarity in city centre hotels. Staff are helpful and courteous, and facilitated access to the Florence Nightingale Museum (in a barracks; needs 48 hours notice and ID faxed ahead) without batting an eyelid. This hotel was like an oasis of calm and comfort to which we retreated from the bustle of the city, after each long day of sightseeing in Istanbul. It is close to the University and in easy walking distance of the Grand Bazaar and the Spice Bazaar; the (cheap and simple to use) trams to Sultanahmet (where are Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, the old Hippodrome etc.) stop practically outside the door, and a fleet of taxis service the hotel for trips off the beaten track. In a week in Istanbul, we didn't see a hotel we would prefer to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for money”
Reviews.Author: PAOLODEL
Reviews.Content: Location although is not great is ok. Close to Ayaa Sofia by Tram and easy to reach all major attractions Clean room , breakfast ok and people though nothing special polite . Room service charges were ok and overall we felt happy for the deal we got

Reviews.Title: “Beware of double charges and don't bother with this property.”
Reviews.Author: 12345Dc
Reviews.Content: Overall, I expected a 5 star hotel and found it to meet barely a 3-star level. The bed was extremely uncomfortable even though I was in a King-suite. Wireless internet access was spotty in the room. The most frustrating experience though was being charged twice for breakfast two times. My rate included full breakfasts and I confirmed that upon check-in. Because I often work in the morning before heading off for meetings, I, as usual, called the desk and requested two continental breakfasts to be brought to my room for us. Nothing was said about a charge although I expected to pay a tray service comparable to that provided at other hotels (5 euros at most). I did this on two mornings and when I checked out was hit with paying twice for the breakfasts that I had in the room. The "extra" charge was higher than the regular breakfasts and I had never been informed of this. Despite an appeal to the manager on duty and a letter of complaint to the International Hotel Group, nothing was done to address this. A friend of mine who is Turkish even tried to get this resolved all to no avail.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: rklac
Reviews.Content: i had to spend one night in smokers room besides my request for nonsmokers. the swimming pool opens only at 8am, so not usable for business customers before work (its less than ten meters long and crowded if there a re more than two persons in it). tiny bathroom with same size as the shower. block 1 is noisy due to breakfast hall in its centre.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: AlanWWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Crowne Plaza many times. It has a superb location close to the covered bazaar and a 5 minute light rail ride or 15 minute walk, to the Aya Sofie and the Blue Mosque (the map does not do it justice) The staff are always friendly and professional and always provide excellent service. The rooms are of a high quality and very tastefully decorated and the morning buffet is excellent. A hidden fact is that there are high quality and inexpensive clothing shops all around the hotel (best area are the side roads on the other side of the rail line)

Reviews.Title: “Very Good but should be better still”
Reviews.Author: Valencian's
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a fabulous trip to Istanbul and we based ourselves in the Crowne Plaza. The hotel location, layout, facilities and services offered are very good but unfortunately the staff are only average. They are not particularly looking to help and they're not going about their job with a smile, it's as if they are just doing the job they've been given and no more. Upon arrival at the hotel we were shown to a very tiny folly of a room which fortunately we could change and after this we had no real problem with our accommodation. The swimming pool is smallish but for a city hotel good and the gym equipment equally good. Free WIFI is available through-out the hotel and as long as you're OK with a slightly intermittent service, which was OK by us, it's a good offering. We only took breakfast in the hotel as there are so many good restaurants in the city and we wanted to explore Turkish cuisine rather than international hotel offerings so can't comment on lunch or dinner. We saw many of the great city attractions from the hotel and walked to most of them and within fifteen to twenty minutes we could reach them all so from a location point of view it is excellently positioned. Knowing what I know of the Crowne Plaza Istanbul I would return but with a slightly lower expectation than I had at the outset of this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: SAC-from-Montreal
Reviews.Content: I strongly recommend this hotel. In terms of service, it was great. The staff was responsive, even with the oddest request (we wanted a knife delivered to our room to eat some cheese and crackers we had bought). The room was large, had great TV service, and great bathroom, and made for a comfortable trip. The bed was excellentâ€”I think it had memory foam mattress (but I didnâ€™t check). The location was excellent, tooâ€”an easy walk to the tramway, and a slightly longer walk to the Metro station. (Itâ€™s about 5 blocks.) On a decent day, itâ€™s easy to walk to most of the major sites like the Grand Bazaar (about 5 to 10 minutes), Topkapi Palace and the Archeology Museum (about 20 to 30 minutes, depending on your pace), Great service. Responsive staff. Great location. Use the tramsâ€”convenient. The Metro is fine, tooâ€”but a little further away. The hotel also offers free Internetâ€”not just wireless access in the room, but also use of a free station in the business centre. The only hassle is trafficâ€”the poor taxi driver seemed to have to solve the Rubikâ€™s cube puzzle to get through to the hotel, because the streets nearby are so narrow and crowded. But if itâ€™s your first trip to Istanbul, Iâ€™d still recommend getting a taxi from the airport to the hotel. That said, once you become familiar with the public transit system, itâ€™s faster and easierâ€”less than half the time. But as I said, this is a minor issue and not a reflection of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient and superb service”
Reviews.Author: MarkHazelbaker
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel which will satisfy travelers who want a nice, clean hotel like those they're used to in the United States and Europe. We had a tiny room on the fourth floor and it was still more than adequate. The staff speaks English very well and is extraordinarily courteous and helpful. Location -- easy walking distance to all the main sights in historic Istanbul. The neighborhood is very safe. The food in the restaurant is good but pricey. Breakfast buffet is expensive but substantial and worth the price if you can fill up for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from the top floor!”
Reviews.Author: benzz
Reviews.Content: First, the good. Istanbul is a beautiful city with thousands of years of history, and the Crowne Plaza is a good location to use as a jumping-off point. It's less than a 10-minute walk to the Grand Bazaar, and only about another 10 minutes to the Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia, Topkapi Palace and the Byzantine Cisterns, which are all located in Sultanahmet. The only downside is that you might not want to walk back at night, and taxis in Sultanahmet will charge you 2-3x the going rate. The hotel itself is actually four separate buildings connected by a glass-ceilinged courtyard that functions as the lobby, which is really quite breathtaking....the pics here on TripAdvisor really don't do it justice. The only problem is that the equivalent of two full flights of stairs awaits you in the walk from the curb to the front desk....you'd better hope the bellhops aren't busy when you arrive, or you'll be hoofing your luggage up five small (3-7 steps) sets of stairs just to check in. Once you've got your room key, you'll need to make sure that the front desk tells you which elevator to use. There are eight total, two for each building...but the buildings only connect on the ground floor, so unless you take the right one you'll be wandering the halls of one of the blocks of rooms searching for a room that isn't there. More frustration may await if your room happens to be on the 4th floor, since the elevators only go to the 3rd floor. The top floor is accessible only by small spiral staircases....make sure hotel personnel carry your heavier luggage up these. When we booked our rooms (for a local convention), the only ones left were suites. My wife and I were the first of our party to arrive, and were assigned rooms on the top floor....our suite literally looked like the attic in an old farmhouse. Low, vaulted ceilings required us to be careful not to hit our heads when walking in the corners of the room, and our only windows were small circular portholes....artificial light was the only way to adequately light the room. More annoying was the musty, mildewy smell that permeated the entire room....surprising, since the hotel claims it has been refurbished bottom-to-top within the last year. You never know if the hotel room you've booked (no matter how bad it is) is actually the best room in the house or not, so I kept my mouth shut until the rest of our party arrived and I saw the two suites they were assigned (on lower floors). They were easily twice the size, had large bay windows and had zero offending odor. We immediately asked for another room, and were disappointed to be given another 4th floor location. However, this room had no smell. Good enough. We didn't take advantage of the fitness center or the pool, but we did eat breakfast each day at the buffet. The quality of the food seemed to vary from day-to-day, but overall we were rather disappointed. That said, the coffee was incredible....possibly the best I've ever had. In the future I think we'll probably stay in the Sultanahmet area, since there are so many cafes and restaurants nearby...there are also quite a bit more hotel options, from large chains to small boutique properties. The Crowne Plaza wasn't terrible, but the mere existence of rooms like our first one ensures no more than three stars on my scale. You're probably better off elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and hotel but only interested in your money”
Reviews.Author: stephens1st
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Crowne Plaza, Intercontinental and Holiday Inns across the World and am a Platinum Ambassador member of the Priority Club. This normally would offer many benifits but not at this hotel. The hotel itself it great. Good location, good sized clean rooms and a lovely Old building that has been well refurbished. Unfortunatley the staff from top to bottom need a re education in customer service. On my last day at the hotel after pushing, the general manager agreed to meet with me to discuss my concerns. He said all of the right things etc but when it came to action he did nothing. All they were intested in were taking my money as I left. If you need a good room in a good location stay at this hotel but do not expect to be treated with any TLC.

Reviews.Title: “Good modern hotel -- good for kids”
Reviews.Author: Pablo034
Reviews.Content: Pros -- Very modern clean hotel. All of the amenities you'd expect in a top hotel. The wireless internet connection from the rooms is free. They have an indoor pool, which is great for kids. The rooms are nice, the beds very comfortable, with flat screen televisions. They also restocked the room with bottled water, without charge, which is great in a country where you shouldn't drink the tap water. Also for kids, the cable television has plenty of channels in English including Disney Channel. The room service menu is a bit limited, but they have an okay hamburger. The Turkish food in the restaurant itself is very good. Cons -- Location is good, but not great. It is an easy 15-min walk to the main sites (Grand Bazaar, Hagia Sophia, etc) and near the tramway, but the immediate area around the hotel is dominated by textile and clothing stores catering to Russian buyers. There are not very many good restaurants in the immediate area (except Sait Iskender Kebab) so we ended up eating dinner in other areas. The hotel offers babysitting services but it is ridiculously expensive -- US$100 an hour! -- but they will reduce the fee if you negotiate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Crowne Plaza-Old City”
Reviews.Author: DeeinJapan
Reviews.Content: Hotel situated nicely close to the grand bazaar. Hotel will get taxi's at a better rate than on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable but not for long stay”
Reviews.Author: Panguin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on a small road in a touristy part of town. So most rooms should be quiet, especially at night. The hotel is not very welcoming at first sight. There were steps instead of ramps all the way from the road to the room. My room was on the 4th floor and as the elevators ended at the 3rd floor, I had to walk an extra floor. This means that for many people, a porter is needed to get their luggage to the room. After you climb the stairs to the hotel, it looks pretty impressive. There was a wow factor. The hotel looks new with polished marble on the floor. In the room, the toilet wall was marbled. The rooms were small. Thanks to my Priority card, I got an upgrade and so I had a reasonably sized room with two chairs and a working desk. They refused to upgrade my colleague even though we were travelling together and there were empty rooms. And so she ended up with a room that had basically just walking space around the bed and a passage to the bathroom. Only in Hawaii and Hongkong have I seen tinier rooms. The Internet was advertised as free but it kept going off and was off for one whole evening. There was no attempt at service recovery, eg an apology or something to make up. The restaurant was expensive and not good for the dinner I had. The only reason I ate in was that I was snowed in. On the plus side, it is in a good quiet location. Amenities are round the corner. The gym was good as my colleague and I were the only two who worked out. Breakfast had a pretty good spread but was more or less the same daily so I pity the traveler who has to stay two weeks. All in all, the hotel has improved markedly. There is still room to improve but one cannot be too demanding of a place like Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Posh but boring”
Reviews.Author: oasinouroboros
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for almost two weeks and spent most of the time working in my room throughout my stay. It offered everything I hoped for; nice room, good and free fitness and spa facilities (I worked out every day, and was alone every time), a decent restaurant with efficient room service (alltough, the menu started getting a bit tiresome on the second week...) a good breakfast, with some parts of it rotating every second day. When checking in, I got a very spacious corner room which was very nice as the size was almost suite-class. The downside was a lot of noise from the busy street, but as I have no problems sleeping it didn't really matter to me. The WLAN was too poor to work in the room, and when I complained they blamed the weather (??), but gave me an ethernet cable, which worked fine for me. The weather changed, but the WLAN didn't work in my room at any time during my stay, but I didn't care as the cable was good enough. Most of the staff was extremely helpful, but some of them(including reception) didn't speak too good English. I wanted a big hotel wich didn't have such an intimate feeling as some tiny boutique hotels, and this was exactly that. The large marble lobby was posh and impressive. The hotel bar was dead and there was really nothing going on here. The location is a good 15 minute walk from the historical sights, but the tram runs right outside the hotel so it's very easy to get there. The neighbourhood, however, isn't really Old City, but starting to border Laeli/Aksaray suburbs, which offer a lot of shopping opportunities in the daytime, but it's also some sort of a red light district and a bit dodgy at night, so as a single male I didn't feel comfortable walking around too much alone in the nighttime. As long as you're not alone and stick to the bigger roads it should be fine. As a final tip, I found a very good and cheap "locantas", (local buffet restaurant )just down the street a couple of hundred meters. From the hotel entrance turn left, and immediately right on the main street. Walk down on the right side for a few hundred meters.

Reviews.Title: “Good locaation, fresh & clean”
Reviews.Author: Belgian-Brussels
Reviews.Content: Recent hotel - attractive structure which gives the hotel and corridors a "roomey" feeling. Try to avoid rooms on the 4th floor. Nice room deco, fresh and recent. Good breakfast(except the fruit juice... that's a surpise if you see how many fresh juice you can get in the street) - even with small differences each day. (Note: we took a booking breakfast included, but no one ever controlled anything... so maybe you'd take a room only rate ?).Excellent small relax & spa (hamman, steam, sauna, gym, pool). All the pics on their website correctly reflect the hotel, the rooms, the spa. About 20 mins walk from Sultanahmet and tram near by for the airport or anywhere else (including the new city). All in all a good experience, even if there were a few minor service issues (AC not correctly working first day - no slippers or bathrobe in executive suite...).

Reviews.Title: “great stay great place”
Reviews.Author: nycgirl90210
Reviews.Content: staff were nice, most especially one door man in particular (sorry did not get his name) always friendly and welcoming . Great selection of breakfast buffet, only problem was very crowded at certain times. Beds comfortable. Rooms adequately spaced. Bathroom good size in terms of lots of bathrooms nothing was too close to each other including the door. Noise not a big issue. Location near tram and major sites most are near a tram stop so easy to get to. Had a blast in turkey .

Reviews.Title: “OK ACCOMODATION in Istanbul Old Town”
Reviews.Author: Vlod71
Reviews.Content: Maybe the Crowne Plaza is not the perfect place in Istanbul, but is a good choice in terms of location and values for services offered. Room was spacious and clean even tough with no view at all (room was at level 1). Buffet breakfast was good with a wide choice of food and beverages. The hotel is located 10-15 min walk from the Grand Bazaar area and from all main attractions located in Old Town. Spa in the hotel is just OK, I think that the service may be improved (we were not offered any amenities such as soap, bathrobe, slippers, we needed to get towels from our room!).

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, quiet stay”
Reviews.Author: bishkek09
Reviews.Content: We really liked the location of the hotel - quiet, yet close to the major tourist sites. We easily walked to the Grand Bazaar, but you can also take the tram (the stop is right next to the hotel). The hotel is only three stops from the Grand Bazaar and a few more stops to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. We also found nearby the bus stop to Taksim (61b bus). Being that we traveled during the off-season, we got a good deal on our stay. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent luxury”
Reviews.Author: LeitaLuetta
Reviews.Content: The hotel is stunning and beautiful. It is not in the business area of Istanbul but fairly close by taxi to some of the main attractions. It really is pretty with glass elevators inside, very nice buffet breakfast, and very professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: happy_traveller_uk35
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in november can't speak highly enough of the hotel excellent sized room cleaned throughly everyday, No problem with out late checkout request or any other requests we had small but nice fitness center and excellent breakfast although that was bit pricey unless booked in advance. The hotel is also very well located within easy walking distance of the tram and grand bazaar and a 25min walk to the blue mosque etc.

Reviews.Title: “Five star rating but four star quality”
Reviews.Author: bozita
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good position for the Grand Bazaar and tramline. The interior design is good and furnishing of good quality. Rooms ok -could be in a hotel anywhere in the world. The staff need to be better trained in hospitality. It is not as professional as one would expect in a Crown Plaza. No bedroom slippers, no bathrobe. Even in the Spa, there are no bathrobes! To get slippers you have to ask and hope that they understand your gestures as they do not speak English. Spa staff are not smartly attired, they put their own hip hop music on and there is no interchange of words to a client visiting for a massage. No indication of whether to remove clothes, to lie down, and after massage they depart without a word and do not tell you to wait, to get up, etc. Very poor indeed. Staff give the impression that you are interrupting them if you visit. Ah, and the indoor pool water is cold. A bad experience and you do not feel you like to return.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: mitonu
Reviews.Content: Crowne's Plaza hotel in Istanbul, is a brand newly built hotel but they gave terrible, lousy service there. I would advise not staying at this hotel or choose choose the neighborhood where this hotel is located. We did not take their breakfast plan so cannot comment on quality of food. The only good things of this hotel are new amenities in the room, and free internet access in the room (you have to call front desk to ask for user/password for connection to their internet). If Taksim area's hotels are too pricy, I would suggest find something in the Sultanahmet area (near Blue Mosque and Haggia Sofia) instead. This Crowne Plaza hotel did not posess good management style, deserving for a 5-stars hotel ranking. It appeared to me they did not give great service once they knew we booked through internet services. Truly, if it was their orders to mis-treat internet-booking guests then the hotel management ought not allow for internet bookings - Period. On our 1st day, when we arrived to front desk, the 1st attendant asked for my name, she checked her hotel record, then passed me to another male attendant. He gave us a room on 4th floor. It was a room in the attic with low ceiling and cut-off windows. Their hotel elevators only went up to 3rd floor and we had to walk another flight of stairs to 4th floor. We asked to switch to another room and they said the hotel was all booked. Secondly, It was written at their website that a complimentary bottle of wine were given as promotional offer for any hotel booking. It took me 4 times asking front desk for this complimentary bottle of wine ! First they denied the promotional offer and after seeing their bad service and treatment, I felt that I should insist to have it. Finally after 2 days and 4 times of asking, they gave me a tiny (1 glass size) bottle of red wine. On 1st night, I asked front desk for a wake up call and never received it in the morning. When I inquired about this on the next day, instead of apologize properly to any guest, they just denied, said they did call. When we checked out, they never gave us an invoice. When we asked for invoice they were reluctant to provide. I find this to be quite absurd. The hotel is located in sub-par neighborhood, with many aggressive, hungry men in surrounding streets looking to make their sale pitch by hollering, by following us or throwing sexual remarks. They gave us quite a scare on 1st nite walk around the block. This neighborhood is not good location for female travellers especially. Even the tour guide recommended not walking around there after 9 or 10 pm. We also ran into a couple of honeymooners from Spain at the hotel and the wife shared with us her same fear. Need I mention further, she was with her husband and she still felt similar scare. Besides the bad hotel choice... if you visit Istanbul, do take the 1 day sight-seeing Bosphorus cruise and see the Sultan's Summer palace. Very nice architecture and grand tour of the palace. Do try the Turkish bath (called Hamam) at certain reputable location only. The location we were recommended, was called "Cemberlitas Hamami", sited in a historical building, at Cembelitas metro stop. There are various price packages. I took the top package for 105 Euro and received a full body scrub by a female attendant, facial mask and 1/2 hour full body massage. Certainly, it was an interesting experience indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: dartmeet
Reviews.Content: Huge hotel in prime location just off main road, near tram stop and good eateriesand 4 tram stops from main sights. Breakfast buffet varied and appetising. only negative was synthetic orange juice. Liked our room for having two easy chairs in window. Staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty,disorganised,don't even consider it !”
Reviews.Author: PeebeeQld
Reviews.Content: Booked suite for my wife and myself and room for our daughter. Arived on a Sunday and thought maybe the cleaners did not work on that day,it appears that they do not work any day! After three days I asked them to clean up the dirt and broken glass outside our daughters room and the rest of the passage way. They cleaned up the glass outside the room but not the rest of the passage way. At the same time I asked them to clean the squashed flies from our windows that had been there since we arrived....took two more days to happen,on the day we were checking out. Hole in bathroom wall,both room door and bathroom door would not lock. Three days had to ring down to get clean towels as they took used ones away but did not replace. Room service dishes left in hall for days.Hallway not swept or vacuumed for whole five days we were there. Told them I would be writing to Trip Advisor and they offered me a birthday cake (for our daughter) not to! Hotel name Crowne Plaza Old City but is not in Old City,but the Russian garment area,great if you came to Istanbul to see Russians and wholesale clothing stores! Great city with friendly people,just a very,very ordinary hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A quality hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ibwales42
Reviews.Content: This is a top quality hotel hotel that we would definitely recommend to others. It was modern, clean, quiet and excellent value.The rooms were very well appointed and the hotel has a complimentary gym, sauna and pool. It was an oasis after the hustle and bustle of Istanbul - but we really liked the city. The staff were great. The hotel is located a little away 'from the action' but the accommation more than makes up for it. We routinely walked to Sultanhamet (which is where the main sites are located) but it was wasy to hop on the frequent and inexpensive metro if you prefer. Breakfasts were a bit pricey as you would expect in an international style hotel so we just ate out.

Reviews.Title: “nice staff, terrible buffet”
Reviews.Author: eurocanadianhill
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. It is clean and the rooms are comfortable. It is NOT a 5* hotel as we were led to believe. It was over priced at the time we booked 177 euro per night but we thought we were getting a five star. Breakfast was included but food was always cold and poor quality. would not stay again at this price. At a lower rate, i would recommend for location.

Reviews.Title: “Accomodations Good, Location Not Very Good”
Reviews.Author: albarraza
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an American hotel in Istanbul, then this is your place. However, its location is less than ideal - there is a great deal of foot traffic on the street, and the neighborhood is a little seedy.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in room 2414”
Reviews.Author: CheshireMaj
Reviews.Content: Room 2414 is on the top floor in the roof space. The furniture and fittings were very good, but the ceiling was very low and to see out of the window, it was necessary to kneel on the floor. The worst feature was the air conditioning unit ( I think it was for the kitchen) on the roof of our room. It came on at 6.30am every day and sounded like a plane taking off (very frightening the first time we heard it) The noise continued throughout the day and went off some time in the early morning. We should have asked to change rooms, but when we mentioned it at reception as we were leaving, we were more or less told it was our own fault for putting up with it. Breakfast on the first morning was also quite difficult, we were given a table but lost it to someone else while we were getting food, we were then moved off two other tables before we spoke to the manageress who told us to look until we found an empty table! It was very busy in the restaurant but no need for her rudeness. Apart from these points, the hotel and staff were quite good, but probably not 5 star standard.

Reviews.Title: “Stuff are great”
Reviews.Author: ShoneBG
Reviews.Content: I just want to say that when we arrived with taxi and my daughter was sleeping, the stuff opened our doors, took our badgage and took my daughter into arms and put her gently on sofa in lobby, while checking in. So, if I go again in Istanbul, I shall stay in this hotel again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “not impressive”
Reviews.Author: ramis_hussain11
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 days in crown Plaza & I found hotel not impressive .staff are rude and not listen the issues. First day my bathroom was not working and it sloved atlest after 15 hours & 3 reminders Break fast was juts ok and Gym is very small as they have only 4 machines. The good thing in this hotel is location & interior . I cant give full marks to this hotel as 5 star but i will recomend this hotel to all due to hotel location .

Reviews.Title: “Best Value, Great and highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: roubey
Reviews.Content: I stayed at crowne plaza hotel for 4 nights, great place (old palace been renovated in 2008) wonderful location, easy access to all transportation (tram, taxi and buses, etc) Transportation to and from Hotel: When you arrive to Ataturk International Airport (IST) you need to take the metro (1.5 LT) and stop at Zeytinburmu "Interchange station" then you need to take the tram to Lalei Univ (you need to pay again 1.5 LT, each token == 1.5LT) to ride the metro, train or/and tram for each ride you need to pay 1.5 LT make sure in each ride you have sufficient token rather than exchanging them from the shops or stations. To reach the hotel you will pass 10 stops to reach Lalei Univ. To arrive Taksim Square you need to reach Kabatas station and then ride the Funicular (similar to the Metro), you will arrive Taksim Square (Middle of the Square). For any trip (cruise) Buyuk Ada "Princesses island" or Borsa you can go through Eminonu Port (one of the tram stop) the ticket will cost you 1.5 LT, no need to go through your travel agency and pay more than 50 Euro or Dollar. The hotel is very clean 5* hotel, near to AyaSofya Museum and blus Mosque (you need to stop at Sultanahmet station to reach them 5 min in the tram and 15 minutes by walking). Many shopping mall with direct access from Taksim, just ride the metro from Taksim and stop at Levant station, then you can go to Canyon mall "largest and newest mall in Istanbul" or Metro City Mall in the same stop. I highly recommend to do your shopping from MetroCity.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Hera34
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with big rooms in a very convenient location.Very close to tramway (laleli Universite) station and therefore with only 1.5 , TL. the Sultanahmet is only 3 stops away.We booke via their webpage and we got a very reasonable price of 105 euros including breakfast Breakfast was ok with a big variety but even coffee is self service (though at least 5 waiters were around ) and food prices in room service very reasonable.Service is what needs improvement as almost everybody seemed too bored or tired to serve guests. Only exception to that was housekeeping We enjoyed very much the Vosporus cruise ( hop on to one of the boats at eminonu that cost only 5 euros for 1 hour 40 minutes cruise) and fall in love with the colours and vibes of the Egyptian market Overall a very positive experience .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Legaldds
Reviews.Content: If you are in Istanbul for a short time and want to be close to all the historic sights, this is probably one of the best deals you can find. The hotel location is great with easy access to trams. However, you sacrifice the peace and quite that you would get by staying in a hotel north of the golden horn. The hotel is on a busy street and naturally noisy. However, some might like to experience the authentic side of Istanbul. The staff was generally helpful, but I was a little baffled by their attempt to nickel and dime you. They quote the rate in Euro but convert it to Lira. When I mentioned that I would like to pay in Euro, all of a sudden I was informed that the statement that they had printed was mistaken and changed the exchange rate. It was only a few dollars, but just sad that they do that. If they quote you in Euro, you should be able to pay in Euro. Breakfast was good, but a 5 star hotel should serve fresh Orange juice not Tang.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel for Shopping stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: BirdieElGounaRedSea
Reviews.Content: This review is for our first stay of four days at the Hotel - Service, room and organization was first class. The location is excellent for a shopping tour from morning to evening. From Hotel organized transfer fees from and to the airport are extremely expensive - it's convenient to organize with taxi. At the 2nd stay after ten days (back from Izmir) we got a very small and dark room with no pleasant view b. The ut for the same rate as at the first stay. Spa is not very inviting - pool small and dark .

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: BenBagBag
Reviews.Content: Good location, near tram line (tip: use it its cheap and airconditioned) and within walking distance to the Grand Bazaar (tip: get there early for breakfast as the shops are opening up). Typical modern large 5* hotel room. Grand foyer. Good breakfast. Would recommend. Got good rate on ICH website as we booked 14 days in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: f1frenzy
Reviews.Content: My young family and I stayed in this hotel from 4th-9th june, the staff were always at hand to help with anything, this hotel is beautiful in and outside, we stayed on the mosque side and was hardly disturbed, when I did hear it the calls for prayer made our holiday a reall authentic delight, and brought culture to the holiday, we had room service many times during our stay for breakfast and evening meal and were very reasonably priced. I was impressed with the pool which helped to cool down after long days walking from site to site. The only thing that disappointed me was the taxi drivers in and around the area which try to charge you far more, or use slieght of hand, or take you on longer trips to reach your destination. Excellent hotel and excellent stay. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul Rocks !”
Reviews.Author: KiwiR0b
Reviews.Content: We booked the Crowne Plaza thru a package deal via ebookers , 5 nights in Turkey flying on Turkish Airlines and a total price of 734 pounds for 2. We were in room 4406 on the top floor , the room was large with a seperate lounge and plasma tv , king size bed with plasma and shower over the bath . The bath was FABULOUS..It was long and deep and we both fitted in with room to spare! We also loved the bed as it was comfortable and large. There was road noise but after 10pm it seemed to stop. The hotels gym was not too bad considering it only had 3 cardio machines but it had a good rande of dumbells and a indoor pool with sauna and spa . We didnt eat at the hotel but had drinks in the lobby/bar area and found it pleasant enough . The hotel is located near the tram stop Lalalei University and it costs 1.50 lira to use . Bear in mind you need to buy a Jeton which is a token first but these are easy to buy from shops located near/next to the tram stops. We caught the metro and then the tram in from the airport ,not only was it easy but also cheaper the the vultures posing as taxi drivers . Take the metro from the lower ground floor making sure you buy at least 2 Jetons each and get off 6 stops later at Zeythinburu , transfer to the tram that heads to Kabatas and get off at Lalelei University and walk 2 blocks down the road and turn right into Fetherby and the hotel is 25m on the right. The hotel was within walking distance of the grand bazzar and also the blue mosque and Sophia Hagia. Try the side streets around Sultanmet for food but be aware some try and add a service charge even tho it doesnt say so on the menu . We refused to pay and they backed down. We found the Crowne Plaza to be a pleasant hotel and would recomend it to most people .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: molly1234
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights and loved this hotel. Free internet, good breakfast, room was quiet (not on mosque side), very clean, lots of shops and restaurants nearby, etc. Bellboy placed my suitcase on another tour's bus by mistake and these people bent over backwards (let me watch security video, etc.) to find my stuff. They located it at the airport (where I was headed), called for me and through the efforts of the front desk staff, I was reunited with my suitcase! Only negative is the stairs with no railing to get into the luxurous lobby. Stay here!

HotelInfo.Name: Crowne Plaza Istanbul Old City
HotelInfo.Address: Ordu Caddesi 226, Laleli Eminonu | Laleli, Istanbul 34134, Turkey
